Example: Funding a retirement plan
Assume a 35-year-old investor wants to retire in 25 years at the age of 60. She expects
to earn 12.5% on her investments prior to her retirement and 10% thereafter. How
much must she deposit at the end of each year for the next 25 years in order to be
able to withdraw $25,000 per year at the beginning of each year for 30 years?
Answer:
This is a 2-step problem. First, determine the amount that must be on deposit in
the retirement account at the end of Year 25 in order to fund the 30-year, $25,000
annuity due. Second, compute the annuity payments that must be made to achieve
the required amount.
